notes.reading-notes:
SAMPLE NOTES ON READING PASSAGE
TOPIC: Burr's career (positive)
positive achievements in Burr's career:
honors graduate from Princeton University (1772)
lieutenant colonel in continental army (1775–1779)
member of New York legislature (from 1784)
U.S. senator (from 1791)
vice president of U.S. under Jefferson (1801–1805)
notes.listening-notes:
SAMPLE NOTES ON LISTENING PASSAGE
TOPIC: Burr's career (negative)
negative situations in Burr's career:
duel with Hamilton (Burr's character criticized by Hamilton; Hamilton challenged to duel and fatally wounded by Burr)
plot to create empire in North America (empire centered in New Orleans planned by Burr; Burr tried for treason)

check-list.item-text: I noted the main points of the reading passage.
I noted the main points of the listening passage.
I used careful planning to outline my response.
I began with an overall topic statement.
I used transitions to connect the supporting ideas.
